caution.para: Do not modify or substitute parts.

svcsubsecinfo.para: Do not use a cutting torch to remove any attaching fasteners, to remove the beams from the axles or to remove the bushings from the beam centers or ends.

All Hendrickson beams are heat-treated for strength and long service life. The use of heat (cutting torch or welding) on suspension components will shorten the life of these parts. A part that is damaged in this manner may fail in operation.

Aluminum components (such as beams) can be damaged with prolonged exposure to salt or acid wash, or by contact with hard objects that gouge the parts. A part which is excessively damaged may fail in operation.

note.para: Aluminum components are lightweight options to be used where weight reduction is desirable. Use aluminum parts only where the rated capacity of the suspension will not be exceeded.

Bushings for 340 through 450 Series suspension systems are available with the end plug as a separate item, for use only with special tools (portable hydraulic service equipment). Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS, Figure 44, Figure 45, and Figure 46.

svcsubsecinfo.para: If you are using Special Tools, follow the instructions supplied by the tool manufacturer.

note.para: To inspect bushings for replacement, refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT, for specifications.
